Title: OpenSSH: Multiple Vulnerabilities
Synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSH, the worst of which could result in arbitrary code execution.

Background.Text: OpenSSH is a free application suite consisting of server and clients that replace tools like telnet, rlogin, rcp and ftp with more secure versions offering additional functionality.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSH. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All OpenSSH users should upgrade to the latest version:
